titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the 16 Hubbard Place photographs V1981.286
titlestmt.author: Weatherly Stephan
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:19:39 +0000.

did.abstract: 16 Hubbard Place (formerly known as Hubbard Lane), located in the Flatlands neighborhood of Brooklyn, was originally the residence of John Lott Williamson (1828-1895), a school teacher, and his wife, Rebecca Stryker Kouwenhoven (1833-1903). Construction of the home at 16 Hubbard Place was completed in 1869. This collection contains three copy prints of the house and barn at 16 Hubbard Place, circa 1920.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); 16 Hubbard Place photographs, V1981.286, Box number, Object ID number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: Item-level description and digital versions of images from the collection are available for searching via the image database in the library.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright will remain in effect for 120 years following the date of creation. All images in this collection will enter the public domain by 2040. For information on securing rights to publish or reproduce, please see the Brooklyn Historical Society Reproduction Rights Policy.
